H0.text: Energy resources are replenished more quickly than they are used.

H1.text: Material resources are replenished more quickly than they are used.

H2.text: Renewable resources are replenished more quickly than they are used.

H3.text: Nonrenewable resources are replenished more quickly than they are used.

A4.text: Water can be considered a renewable material when carefully controlled usage and temperature, treatment, and release are followed.

A5.text: Renewable resources are endangered by non-regulated industrial developments and growth.

A6.text: The two most important forms of renewable energy, solar and wind, are intermittent energy sources: they are not available constantly, resulting in lower capacity factors.

A7.text: Demand for lithium is expected to grow 42-fold from 2020 to 2040.

A8.text: Renewable resources are available each year, unlike non-renewable resources, which are eventually depleted.

A10.text: Using the lower estimate, just 5% of the available wind energy would supply the current worldwide energy needs.
